intro: Stigmaphyllon rhombifolium, commonly known as the diamond-leaf stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
